quiz.text: "...instill into the vast millions of workers, men and women, who actually do the job, a sense of partnership and of cooperative performance..." The above passage relates to
options: Planned Development
Community Development
Panchayati Raj System
Integrated Development Programme
None of the above

quiz.text: Five Year Plan in India is finally approved by
options: Union Cabinet
President on the advice of Prime Minister
Planning Commission
National Development Council
Parliament

quiz.text: What is the type of Indian economy?
options: Socialist
Communist
Capitalist
Mixed
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is not correct about 'Bombay Plan'?
options: The Bombay Plan is also called the 'A plan for Economic Development of India'
It was started in 1944
It was drafted by GD Birla and JRD Tata
There were 10 members in this plan
None of the above

quiz.text: When was 'Gandhian plan' started?
options: 1944
1952
1934
1948
1950

quiz.text: Who was the author of the Book 'Planned Economy of India'?
options: M. Visvesvaraya
Dada Bhai Nairobi
Bhim Rao Ambedkar
Jawaharlal Nehru
Indira Gandhi

quiz.text: Mahalanobis Plan Model adopted in India in the Mid-fifties aimed at?
options: Building a strong defence industry base
Setting up heavy industries which were capital intensive
Curbing inflation in the economy
Removing unemployment within a short period
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is not correct?
options: There is no constitutional provision in India about the Planning Commission
Planning commission was established in March 1950
National Development Council was established in August 1950
Jawaharlal Nehru was the first chairman of the Planning Commission
National Development Council is Non-constitutional and non-statutory

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is not correct?
options: The first five year plan was launched from 1st April, 1951
The first five year plan gave emphasis on Heavy Industrialization
The first five year plan was from 1951-1956
The first five year plan was based on the Harrod- Domar model
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not matched correctly?
options: First Five Year Plan: 1951-56
Third Five Year Plan: 1961-66
Seventh Five Year Plan:1980-85
Tenth Five Year Plan: 2002-07
Twelfth Five Year Plan : 2012 -17

quiz.text: Which of the following are the four components of Nehru- Mahalanobis Strategy ?
options: The need for a comprehensive programme of import-substituting industrialisation to break out of the syndrome of centuries of economic backwardness
A conscious bias towards heavy industries
The commanding role of the state in a ‘mixed’ economy with a private sector
It admitted the use of foreign aid to facilitate the growth of capital goods and infrastructure sectors
All of the above

quiz.text: Given below are two statements, one labelled as Assertion (A) and the other labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A): An important policy instrument of economic liberalization is a reduction in import duties on capital goods. Reason (R): Reduction in import duties would help the local entrepreneurs to improve technology to face the global markets In the context of the above two statements, which one of the following is correct?
options: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation
Both A and R are true R is not a correct explanation
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true
None of the above

quiz.text: Economic liberalization in India started with:
options: Substantial changes in industrial licensing policy
The convertibility of Indian rupee
Doing away with procedural formalities for foreign direct investment
Significant reduction in tax rates
None of the above

quiz.text: The planning process in the industries sector in India has assumed a relatively less important position in the nineties as compared to that in the earlier period. Which one of the following is not true in this regard?
options: With the advent of liberalisation, industrial investment development has largely been placed within the domain of private and multinational sectors
With market assuming a central place, the role of central planning in many sectors has been rendered redundant
The focus of planning has shifted to sectors like human resource
The nation's priorities have shifted away from industrial development to rural development
None of the above

quiz.text: During which Five Year Plan was the Emergency clamped, new elections took place and the Janata Party was elected?
options: Third
Fourth
Fifth
Sixth
Seventh

quiz.text:
To understand the problem of underdevelopment in India at the time of independence, we need a historical perspective. India’s colonial experience provides that perspective. The framework of political economy requires that we look at colonial impact on broad sectors of the economy and social classes.

Since the eighteenth century, the world economy has been transformed by two major forces: (i) Industrial Revolution, and (ii) colonialism. These forces combined to divide the world into ‘developed’ and ‘developing’ economies.

Industrial Revolution in Western Europe, especially Britain, led to significant increases in productivity of labour and prosperity there. However, the benefits of that revolution did not spread over to much of Asia, Africa and Latin America because of colonialism. These regions became especially impoverished after they became colonies. Industrial Revolution and colonialism operated in tandem because the countries that prospered were imperial powers of Europe and the countries which were impoverished were their colonies.

Q. Which sector of the economy dominates India's GDP since the LPG reforms ?
options: Agriculture
Manufacturing
Services
Textile
Mining

These forces combined to divide the world into ‘developed’ and ‘developing’ economies. Industrial Revolution in Western Europe, especially Britain, led to significant increases in productivity of labour and prosperity there. However, the benefits of that revolution did not spread over to much of Asia, Africa and Latin America because of colonialism. These regions became especially impoverished after they became colonies. Industrial Revolution and colonialism operated in tandem because the countries that prospered were imperial powers of Europe and the countries which were impoverished were their colonies. Q. Who is the author of the book 'Poverty and Un-British Rule in India' ?
options: A.O. Hume
Dadabhai Naoroji
W.C. Banerjee
S. Subramanya Iyer
Rabindranath Tagore

Q. Inclusive growth as enunciated in the Eleventh Five Year Plan does not include one of the following:
options: Reduction of poverty
Extension of employment opportunities
Strengthening of capital market
Reduction of gender inequality
None of the above
